channel.title: Music on El Fubu
channel.description: Recent content in Music on El Fubu

item.title: How to config your Vortex Tracker for the MSX computers family
item.description: Hello my friends! This is a reminder for me and for the future generations to come. I’m not going to show you anything very magical or new, but this happen to me and I didn’t have clue about it. So if you didn’t know, now you will! Are you tired of compsing something in Vortex Tracker and hearing something odd when playing it in the machine? Your tracker might be wrongly configured!

item.title: Susumu Hirasawa - Darkness ‚≤° duai + Solid Air
item.description: Susumu Hirasawa appreciation post. Solid Air is part of P-Model works, but Susumu is able to mix it with Darkness ‚≤° duai perfectly. Let’s rumble:

item.title: Castlevania: Order of Ecclesia - Tower of Dolls
item.description: I don’t only live from weird japanese things. Today, some castlevania.

item.title: Vocaloid (P-Model) - Bijutsukan de atta hito daro
item.description: I would have never expected a vocaloid cover of P-Model. But it does exist. And it’s amazing. I have to find the CD “Hatsune Miku Sings New Wave”. Bonus track

item.title: P-model - Spitirus
item.description: Oh Spiritus! Oh SPIiiiiiiiIIIIIIIIIiIiiiiiiiiiiiritussssssssssss!

item.title: Osamu Sato - Transmigration
item.description: Lately I have been only posting music. We’ll, that’s what I like to do at the moment, so… ¬Ø_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø This time I bring you Osamu Sato’s Transmigration. It’s a weird album mixing pseudo-futuristic sound with strange folk chants. I haven’t played through all the Osamu Sato’s Tong-Nou, a superb weird experience into his mind made into a game, however the first song is clearly the opening theme. I hope you enjoy.

item.title: Kiki Vivi Lily - 80denier
item.description: Lately this blog is only about music… ü§î Today we have Kiki Vivi Lily. Yes the name is a bit weird, but her music is pretty good and full of a chill feeling. I hope you like it!

item.title: Denki Groove - „Éî„Ç®„Éº„É´ÁÄß„ÅÆ‰ΩìÊìç42Ê≠≥
item.description: Today we have Denki Groove in the menu with their 42 year old Pierre gimnastics. Probably one of the most eccentric and well done videos that I have ever seen. Wait until the song gets dramatic :). Enjoy!

item.title: P-Model - Speed Tube
item.description: Oh sweet! HIGHHH SPEEEEEEEEEEEEED TUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUBE Yes, I’m very hooked.

item.title: Naibu - Opium Lady
item.description: Good morning! Today I bring you a piece of very cool DnB with some touches of asian feeling. Please, enjoy Naibu:

item.title: Animals As Leaders - The Brain Dance
item.description: A colleague sent this piece to me today. It’s amazing how does it sound with just 3 guys, like with Mouse on the Keys. This is the kind of guitar playing that I like to hear :).

item.title: Mondo Grosso - Labyrinth
item.description: Today I came across this. Enjoy!

item.title: Max cooper - Aleph 2
item.description: Music from the infinity with nice number rendering provided by Aorante. Check the description of the video. It is quite interesting :).

item.description: Today: „Éë„ÇΩ„Ç≥„É≥Èü≥Ê•Ω„ÇØ„É©„Éñ (Pasocom Ongaku Club | Personal Computer music club) Found these guys because of a collaboration they did with YMCK (Family Circus, available on Spotify) I love both the sound and the video. So cool :D. So, here it is: „Éë„ÇΩ„Ç≥„É≥Èü≥Ê•Ω„ÇØ„É©„Éñ - Reiji no Machi Enjoy!

item.title: Makoto - Uplifter
item.description: Some cool breaks for you

item.title: Lo-Fi Zelda
item.description: It’s cool to see how fitting is this song with the Lo-Fi/Vaporwavish style.

item.title: Boards of Canada - Sunshine Recorder
item.description: Probably one of my favourites amongst Boards of Canada sounds. It fits perfect with Hard-Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World, a novel by Haruki Murakami. The ambient fits perfectly with the setting described in the book, most of it quite unsettling, yet really enjoyable.

item.title: MIDIval PunditZ
item.description: Reviewing the Deep Asian Breaks video I went to do some searching on the authors of the tracks… and I found this nice piece of music: I hope you enjoy it :)

item.title: Tabla, DnB, Jazz and Jungle
item.description: So, once again I tried to discover which genre of the song ‚ÄúMen of war‚Äù, which is part of the OST of Breath Of Fire IV (A quite nice PlayStation RPG :)). I tried from tabla breaks to tabla dnb‚Ä¶ couldn‚Äôt find it. Until now! I found this video with a bunch of dnb indian stuff. It misses the tabla but it‚Äôs nice! Leaving the electro world, I found Amrat Hussain Trio:

item.title: Akiko Yano: Rhythm by time
item.description: From ramen to salvation.
